intro: Lophozonia obliqua subsp. andina, commonly known as the Andean lophozonia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it adapts to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, providing protection against strong winds and UV radiation. The flowers, which bloom in the summer, are yellow and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
